alert.note: Alert for Doddridge; Harrison; Ritchie (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 12 at 10:36AM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Ritchie, Doddridge and northern Harrison Counties through 1100 AM EST... At 1036 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles south of West Union, or 13 miles east of Harrisville, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Shinnston, Salem, Lumberport, West Union, Enterprise, Grangeville, Blandville, Avon, Grove, Leopold, Wolf Summit, New Milton, Wallace, Smithburg, Center Point, Sedalia, Canton and Meadowbrook. This includes Route 50 in West Virginia between mile markers 48 and 76. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
